definitions: A college in the United Kingdom that provides education for students aged 16 to 18, typically after they have completed their GCSEs and before they go to university.
An educational institution specializing in the final two years of secondary education in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
examples: She applied to a sixth form college.
The sixth form college offers a variety of A-level courses.
Many students choose a sixth form college for its academic focus.
